name: GetCompactGoals
description:
Retrieve compact goal records from Asana.

Use this tool to get a summary of goals available in Asana. It should be called when you need to access an overview of goals, requiring the 'goals:read' permission scope.

parameters.name: portfolio_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the supporting portfolio in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for supporting portfolio.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project. Used to filter goals associated with a specific project.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for supporting project.

parameters.name: supporting_task_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the supporting task in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for supporting task.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the team. Use this to filter goals associated with a specific team.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace.

parameters.name: time_period_identifiers
parameters.description: A list of globally unique identifiers for the desired time periods to filter the goals.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifiers for the time periods.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of goal records to return per page. Must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination. Use the token from a previous response to retrieve the next page. If not provided, returns the first page.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: included_optional_properties
parameters.description: A list of specific properties to include in the response. Use a comma-separated list format.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty formatting for readable JSON response. Mainly for debugging; increases response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: is_workspace_level
parameters.description: Set to true to filter for goals where the workspace level is active. Must be used with the workspace parameter.

value_schema.description: Filter to goals with is_workspace_level set to query value. Must be used with the workspace parameter.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.
